titleStmt.title: Architecture for Knowledge-Oriented Management of African Normative Texts using Open Standards and Ontologies

info.p: Akoma Ntoso (AKN) "defines a set of simple, technology-neutral electronic representations of parliamentary, legislative and judiciary documents for e-services in a worldwide context and provides an enabling framework for the effective exchange of "machine readable" parliamentary, legislative and judiciary documents such as legislation, debate record, minutes, judgements, etc." (Wikipedia)

In the context of CLARIN, which puts focus on the linguistic features of annotated resources, Parla-CLARIN and ParlaMint are the recommended alternatives (at different levels of generality, coverage and interoperability).

ul.li: Homepage of the OASIS Technical Committee "LegalDocML", of which the AKN is a deliverable.
